definition[0]: a period or process in which business activity, production etc is reduced and conditions become worse
example[1]: a downturn in the auto industry
definition[1]: the part of the economic cycle when prices or the value of stocks, shares etc fall
example[2]: The publishing sector has proved largely immune to economic downturn.
example[3]: Our value-oriented portfolio should serve us well in the event of a market downturn.
example[4]: We have seen a sharp downturn in orders.
